content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Use regular expressions to find all instances of Julia code blocks
    # Code blocks start with `\n```julia` and end with `\n````
    # Replace the code fences with newlines to join the code blocks
    code_blocks = matchall(r"```julia[\s\S]+?```", md)
    if isempty(code_blocks)
        return ""
    end

    # Join all the code blocks together and remove any leading or trailing whitespace
    joined_code = join([c[2:(length(c)-3)] for c in code_blocks], "\n")
    return strip(joined_code)
end
```

This function uses `matchall` to find all instances of Julia code blocks within the markdown document. It then removes the leading and trailing code fences (````julia` and `````) from each code block and joins them together with a newline character. Finally, it strips any leading or trailing whitespace from the joined code.
